A much easier way of doing it would be to do the square of both adjacent sides (to which ever angle you wanted to find) added, then take away the opposite side squared. Then make that the numerator over 2 X one of the adjacent angles X the other adjacent angle. So it would look like this:

50^2 + 60^2 - 20^2
---------------------------
2 X 50 X 60

Which would then give you the 19/20, and then you just do Cos^-1 (19/20) to give you the answer of 18.19487.... or just 18.2.
